column4: with modern drives, I doubt you want a low level format. What are you trying to do?
its ancient, and I am trying to put it back to use n a 98 system
dd if=/dev/urandom of=/dev/hda bs=1024 count=1 <-- run this and then pop in the 98 CD (warning: this command is dangerous)
if there's no partition table, 98se will ask to create one
dd if=/dev/urandom of=/dev/hda bs=1024 count=1           (Warning: dangerous command)
what are you currently running on this system?
so how are you interacting with the system?
ah, you should have mentioned you were in DOS
fdisk, and setup your partitions. Make sure the first one is bootable. If it's older than a P2 the first partition should be less that 1GB
dunno how it work with flopies, I've only done it with a CD
ok bad disk, time for another then
